results.title: Siberia: the endless horizon
results.brief_description: Deals with the nomadic people of Northern Siberia and explains their dependence on the reindeer. Part 3: survival in a cold climate.

results.title: Siberia to the Silk Road
results.creator_credit: Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: Only weeks before the August 1991 coup in Moscow, Australian Greg Grainger embarked upon a ten thousand kilometre odyssey across the U.S.S.R., through Siberia and Central Asia, observing the lives of people at a time of extraordinary change. We observe Russia’ first ever presidential elections, visiting a polling station as Boris Yeltsin makes his historical win. A look at the lives of ordinary people in a time of extraordinary changes. See the stunning beauty of a Siberian summer, journey thousands of kilometres on the Trans Siberian Railway, drink vodka with soldiers and travel the legendary Silk Road through Uzbekistan, visiting ancient cities such as Bukhara and Samarkand.

results.title: Sibelius
results.brief_description: Jean Julius Christian Sibelius, one of the greatest living composers, is known to music lovers throughout the world. In this film, excerpts from the Sibelius Violin Concerto, and from his Impromptu, are played, as well as a short extract from the ballet “Scaramouche”, danced by the Helsinki opera ballet.

results.title: Siam sunset
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Artist Services, South Australian Film Corporation, Al Clark and John Polson
results.brief_description: After his wife is killed in a freak accident involving a falling refrigerator, British industrial chemist Perry (Linus Roache) travels to Australia to escape and in search of an elusive paint colour after seeing a photo of the Australian outback in a travel brochure. He joins the budget price Whippet tour bus, a motley crew of travellers that includes an aspiring country and western singer, bickering couples, and a woman (Danielle Cormack) fleeing her violent, drug dealing boyfriend whose money she has stolen. Disaster follows Perry everywhere and Australia is no exception: earth tremors, a deceased roadside trader, inclement weather, a dangerous ex-boyfriend and New Year’s Eve at a roadhouse in the middle of nowhere after their bus crashes. A humorous coach war between the Whippet driver determined to out drive a competing driver of a swish coach also travelling to Darwin provides a highlight of the film, as is the Australian outback. Cast also includes: Ian Bliss, Roy Billing, Alan Brough, Rebecca Hobbs, Esme Melville.

results.title: Si Versailles M'etait Conte = Affairs in Versailles
results.brief_description:
Shot entirely on location at the Chateau de Versailles, ‘Si Versailles…’ tells, Guitry-style, the story of the famous castle - from humble beginings as a hunting pavillion to classic splendour - and of the many events, affairs and gatherings it hosted. This is a typical Guitry production with a stellar cast, dozens of cameos and more one liners and ‘bonts mots’ than a ‘90s sitcom. As usual Guitry makes light of history, mixing major historical events and sexy anecdotes, while playing the central role of Louis XIV. Although it is an historical film, ‘Si Versailles …’ is ladden with anachronisms and factual errors. A share of the profits of the film went to the restoration and upkeep of the castle.

Credits: Producer, Clement Duhour ; director, Sacha Guitry ; writer, Sacha Guitry ; photography, Pierre Montazel ; music, Jean Francaix ; art direction, Rene Renoux.
Cast: Sacha Guitry, Michel Auclair, Jean-Pierre Aumont, Jean-Louis Barrault, Jeanne Boitel, Gilbert Boka, Bourvil, Pauline Carton, Gino Cervi, Jean Chevrier, Aime Clariond, Claudette Colbert, Nicole Courcel, Danielle Delorme, Jean Desailly, Renee Devi

results.title: Si Spain!
results.creator_credit: Hughes Leisure Group and Thayer Soule
results.brief_description: Filmmaker Thayer Soule takes us on a personal journey through Spain; capturing its colourful history and observing how that past has been integrated into the present. Soule travels through the quiet beauty of Castile, visits the Great Mosque in Cordoba with its 800 arches, treks through the snow-capped peaks of the Pyrenees and experiences the sights and sounds of a bullfight. The music, dancing and culture of Spain is vividly captured in this interesting personal travelogue.

results.title: Si Mamad (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Matari Film, Lambang Film Teledan, Sjuman Djaya and Handojo Misc
results.brief_description: A poor, middle-aged Muslim archivist steals stationery from his office to support his family, only to find that the store to which he sells the stationery to is owned by his boss. He develops an obsessional guilt complex and compulsion to confess his dishonesty. A tragi-comedy, providing some incisive observations of the contemporary scene in Jakarta, in particular the gap between the rich and the poor. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: Si J'etais Un Espion... = Breakdown
results.brief_description:
A doctor pays a house call to one of his regular patient suffering from a nervous ailment. He does not find his patient home but encounters a series of strange characters, all very eager to meet the mysterious Mr. Guerin. Before he knows what happens to him, the good doctor his being coerced into finding Guerin for fear of his life.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Bertrand Blier ; writers, Jacques Cousseau, Jean-Pierre Simonot, Philippe Adrien, Bertrand Blier, Antoine Tudal ; photography, Jean-Louis Picavet ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Bruno Cremer, Patricia Scott, Claude Pieplu, Suzanne Flon.

results.title: Shyness
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: Abnormal shyness in children, its causes and how, through a greater understanding by parents and teachers, this problem may be dealt with. The lonely existence of a typical shy adult is portrayed, and the film then turns to a study of three children: Anna, shy but wistfully wanting association with others; Jimmy, whose excessive timidity is really a symptom of profound emotional disturbance; Robert, aloof but happily independent. Studying their conditions, a psychiatrist from the Child Guidance Clinic reveals the confidence-destroying demands of parents which predisposed the children to shyness. Together, teacher, psychiartrist and parents bring about a change in the children’s attitides. (Awards: Cleveland; New York; Toronto; Boston; Manila.)
